title: SIC! SIC! SIC!
html:
SIC! SIC! SIC!

This trick, described on p. 28 of C.C. Benison's Death at Buckingham Palace, has to be one of the best of the decade: the protagonist runs into the Royal Apartments “to find the Queen draped atop the supine figure of a man in tailcoat and trousers who was lying facedown on the rug.” [Doing a little supine firing perhaps. Submitted by Donald K. Henry, Mill Valley, California.]
